segment.source: Learn how to register an uninstall app for your custom components, using IEAK 11.
segment.target: Learn how to register an uninstall app for your custom components, using IEAK 11.

segment.source: Register an uninstall app for custom components using IEAK 11 (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Register an uninstall app for custom components using IEAK 11 (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Register an uninstall app for custom components using IEAK 11
segment.target: Register an uninstall app for custom components using IEAK 11

segment.source: Register the uninstall apps for any custom components you’ve included in your Internet Explorer 11 package.
segment.target: Register the uninstall apps for any custom components you’ve included in your Internet Explorer 11 package.

segment.source: Registering these apps lets your employees remove the components later, using Uninstall or change a program in the Control Panel.
segment.target: Registering these apps lets your employees remove the components later, using Uninstall or change a program in the Control Panel.

segment.source: Register your uninstallation program
segment.target: Register your uninstallation program

segment.source: While you’re running your custom component setup process, your app can add information to the subkeys in the registry key, registering your uninstallation program.
segment.target: While you’re running your custom component setup process, your app can add information to the subkeys in the registry key, registering your uninstallation program.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: IE11 also uses this registry key to verify that the component installed successfully during setup.
segment.target: IE11 also uses this registry key to verify that the component installed successfully during setup.

segment.source: Subkey
segment.target: Subkey

segment.source: Data type
segment.target: Data type

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: DisplayName
segment.target: DisplayName

segment.source: string
segment.target: string

segment.source: Friendly name for your uninstall app.
segment.target: Friendly name for your uninstall app.

segment.source: This name must match your Uninstall Key in the Add a Custom Component page of the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11.
segment.target: This name must match your Uninstall Key in the Add a Custom Component page of the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11.

segment.source: For more info, see the Custom Components page.
segment.target: For more info, see the Custom Components page.

segment.source: UninstallString
segment.target: UninstallString

segment.source: string
segment.target: string

segment.source: Full command-line text, including the path, to uninstall your component.
segment.target: Full command-line text, including the path, to uninstall your component.

segment.source: You must not use a batch file or a sub-process.
segment.target: You must not use a batch file or a sub-process.
